reviews.review_msg: Do not take his lecture if you hate reading
Greg is absolutely the best ECON prof, but tons of readings to do and questions on the midterms are so broad that I cannot compose well. Nice prof but heavy wrok.
Couse is heavily based on readings, four books per semester, 200 pages each week, kinda ruins all my leisure time.
He is a good prof but you gotta read 100+ tough readings PER WEEK

Professor Dow is truly one of the best profs I have ever had. He makes everything very understandable and clear. You know exactly what to expect on exams, and his lectures prepare you well for them. He is very kind and relaxed, and creates a very friendly learning environment for all students. Highly recommend taking a course with him if you can

Best Econ prof in SFU! Hes lecture notes are so functional and logical. It is definitely worth while to take his class, you can learn the real things! Unfortunately gonna graduated before in person class, otherwise really hope to take his in person lecture if theres any chance!
Best Econ prof ever! Lectures are really interesting . Greg is really kind and knowledgeable... Definitely take other courses with him.
make sure u take notes in his class. but easy midterm and final if u pay attention in the lecture
Simply the best economic professor at SFU.

He is the greatest professor that I have ever hard,Econ354 is not a very hard course even though it is a higher level Econ course. He is great at explaining materials. Make sure you take detailed notes in class, that will help you a lot in the exam! Fantastic course and fantastic professor!!!
Best Econ prof at SFU, period.

Easy, interesting class. Keep up with the readings (the key points and the examples) and his notes and you should be able to pull off a good grade. I ended up with a B, but could have done even better had I put in some effort.

Fairly easy concepts (econ 103/105 concepts). Need to keep up with the readings, 4 books and 4 midterms but no final. Lectures were on economic concepts in complement to the 4 books. Clear graphs and notes in lecture. Overall course = B+, Prof = B+. Not as difficult as it looks.
not really easy but very helpful..it developes your critical thinking!

He's fairly new at teaching and his accent makes it difficult to understand what he's talking about at times. He's clearly educated and knows what he's talking about but can get very wordy in his explanations. Tests were very long, averages around 50% over 4 midterms. Don't take this class unless you want to read a new book every 3 weeks
